speaker: TRANSIT COP PHILBRICK
line: I'm on the Clay Street platform. Got a fare-jumper. White male, shaved head, 20s. Possible 10-13.

speaker: TRANSIT COP PHILBRICK
line: Officer Philbrick, all clear.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Deputy Chief Karras, Transit Police. This is Lieutenant Bianco. You're Scully and Doggett, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. Is the assessment team here?

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Downstairs, waiting 45 minutes. Where the hell have you two been?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully needed to examine the body of the victim first.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Who's missing the picture here? I got lots of people who can examine the body. What I need from the FBI now is a time frame.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A time frame?

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: One of the main arteries of the Boston Public Transport System has been closed for exactly 11 hours and four minutes. My phone is ringing off the hook right now with calls from the press. I got 100,000 pissed-off commuters who were late to work this morning who are going to be even more pissed off if they can't get home. And I got one extremely pissed-off mayor paying me to do one thing-- keep the damn trains running.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, se appreciate the pressure that you're under, but...

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: No. It's you guys better kick it in the ass. The afternoon rush starts in five hours. Do what you've got to do but this line is going back in operation

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm afraid you can't do that.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Oh, yes, I can.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've got a dead man who's got over 1/3 of his body tissue completely eaten away and until we figure out how and why that tunnel cannot be reopened.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: We understand the FBI's need to do a thorough investigation, but as I see it the facts of this case are actually pretty simple.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Simple?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: The train briefly lost power during which time an assailant killed a Boston Transit cop. That man is still at large.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: An assailant using what?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Acid, lye... your examination of the victim must've told us something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it didn't, that's the thing. Until we culture the tissue and run the proper tests we're not going to know what killed him or if it can infect others.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: The centers for disease control had robotic sniffers in the tunnel all night. They found no trace of biological or chemical agents. So let's clear this up. What we're looking for is a man-- a cop-killer. Single suspect.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: At least that's your cover story.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's what you're telling the press.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: The question is can you get me the killer or an explanation in less than five hours? Because hell or high water, the subway reopens at 4 PM sharp. Now let's go.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Steven Melnick, Transportation Authority Chief Structural Engineer. He built this tunnel.

speaker: MELNICK
line: I only oversaw construction of it four years ago. I know every square inch down there.

speaker: LYLE
line: Dr. Hellura Lyle. Special pathogens branch, CDC.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We were told you folks said that the tunnel was free of pathogens.

speaker: LYLE
line: Well, I guess I'm just here for the moral support.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: We're just covering our bases.

speaker: LYLE
line: What base are they covering?

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Agent Scully is a medical doctor. Who they tell me has a lot of experience with equivocal deaths.

speaker: MELNICK
line: Equivocal? Hey, I mean you're dead or you're not, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Deaths for which there may be many explanations or for which an explanation may be hard to find.

speaker: LYLE
line: What about you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm just a good shot.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Well, good. Now that we're bosom buddies, let's get this show on the road.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Do you need some help with that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. You're going in without me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what kinds of game are being played, but I'm going to be much more effective analysing the situation from up here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, but I'm just tag along here. This is your thing. You've got all the experience.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've got capable people with you, Agent Doggett. What I need down there are eyes and ears.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Okay. I'll be your eyes and ears. But I wish somebody would tell me what the hell I'm supposed to be looking for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Third rail's powering down. You're clear to enter the subway floor and as long as you stay on this line there should be no risk of accidental shock or electrocution. You copy that, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yep, we're on the tunnel floor. Hope you got yourself a nice clear picture, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We got you every step of the way.

speaker: (IN THE TUNNEL
line: The members of the team look hot and uncomfortable. They all have a light sheen of sweat on their bodies.)

speaker: HELLURA LYLE
line: Ooh, it feels like Atlanta in August.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, it's the middle of winter. How come it's so hot down here?

speaker: MELNICK
line: They shut down ventilation last night. Normally you have almost a million cubic feet of fresh air per minute pushing through here but now we're in a sweatbox.

speaker: LYLE
line: Aren't we lucky? Hot, sticky and crawling in the dark. All so every commuter in Boston can get home to watch Survivor II.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I wonder why they shut down the ventilation if it's a man we're supposed to be looking for.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: You doubt that so much, Agent Doggett, why bring a gun?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, you still reading me down there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Like a songbird, Agent Scully.

speaker: STEVEN MELNICK
line: My shirt, my neck... Get it off!

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: What's going on?

speaker: STEVEN MELNICK
line: Something's burning! Something's burning!!

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Just, just hold still...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What just happened?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know. He's got a burn on his neck, silver-dollar sized.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You get seepage down here?

speaker: MELNICK
line: Yeah, constantly. This line was tunneled through landfill adjacent to the harbour. It's a part of the Big Dig.

speaker: LYLE
line: There was a puddle 20 yards back.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You hear that, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Ask Dr. Lyle if she can get a sample.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We need you to get a sample.

speaker: LYLE
line: Okay, I'm on it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Maybe it's not a man we're looking for but some sort of toxic leak.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: We were told there are no contaminants down here.

speaker: LYLE
line: Tell her I'm sending this.

speaker: LYLE
line: We're transmitting.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You online, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I got it. I'm getting a reading... Sample analysis is showing carbon, bromide, boron and calcium.

speaker: LYLE
line: It's just seawater.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let me get on the phone. Maybe I can get a molecular analysis.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Four hours, Agent Scully.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Take it easy.

speaker: MELNICK
line: Agent Doggett!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What? What is it?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: There's somebody in the tunnel.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, let's go find him.

speaker: LYLE
line: Open this line in four hours passengers will get more than just a ride-- they'll get a steam bath to boot.

speaker: LYLE
line: Wâ€¦what are you doing?

speaker: MELNICK
line: If this guy was going to shoot me he already had his chance. Besides, I'm sweating like a pig.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mr. Melnick, what's this?

speaker: MELNICK
line: It's a tunnel from the old system. Been shut down for years.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You see this, Agent Scully? You have this on your graphic?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. It's a fork in the line.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: That line is obsolete. It's been gutted and decommissioned.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How far from here to where the train lost power, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's about a mile up the main tunnel.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: He's going to waste valuable time going in there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm just taking a look.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: All right, let's get out of here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mr. Melnick what's your call? You think there's any good reason to pursue this section?

speaker: MELNICK
line: Lots of places to hide in here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dr. Lyle?

speaker: LYLE
line: Agent Doggett, look out!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, what happened? Can you hear me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Nah, give me a minute. What hit me?

speaker: LYLE
line: Well, he came at you like some kind of phantom.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did? Agent Doggett.

speaker: MELNICK
line: Would you call that equivocal?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, okay, I see it. Um, I'm going to need some data.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully needs some data.

speaker: LYLE
line: I'm already on it.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: I think this is the guy that killed Officer Philbrick.

speaker: LYLE
line: I'm transmitting some photos.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Here comes your data, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Where you going?

speaker: MELNICK
line: I think I just saw something.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's the problem?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: There's no problem. This man fits the description called in by my transit cop. We found what we were looking for. Let's get him wrapped up and go home.

speaker: MELNICK
line: See it? There's something on the floor.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, we got bodies. Looks like three males. Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I see them. Can you get any closer?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Smell's a little overpowering. They've been here for a while. Looks like someone wrapped them up and stashed them down here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you get them uncovered?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look like squatters from the way they're dressed. I'm not sure I want to touch these.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I see signs of the same tissue degradation we saw in the other victims. We may have a contagion here after all.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: What did she say?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dr. Lyle, down here.

speaker: LYLE
line: Oh...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The CDC may be wrong.

speaker: LYLE
line: Somebody's over here!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Whatever she saw... What did you see?

speaker: LYLE
line: Somebody out here just took off.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't see where.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Look, we're done down here. Let's get this show on the road.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hold it, Lieutenant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, if there's somebody else down there you're going to need to find him.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: What are you doing, Agent Scully? Get those people out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Those people" just found three dead bodies and I want to know what happened to them.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Look, they are in an obsolete, decommissioned tunnel. I'll get a crew down in there tonight after rush hour.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't understand. They could be infected and contagious.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: With what? Seawater? You are being irrational here. The CDC says there are no contaminants. I'm going to take their word on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then, who are those dead men and how did they die?

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Probably tunnel rats. Squatters attacked by the same man who killed my transit cop.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then take a look at the man who fits the description of your killer, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just look at his injuries, sir. He died the same way. There is something down there and I am not going to risk bringing it up here before I figure out what it is!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you want us to do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you to leave those bodies where you found them and go after whoever it is who's in that tunnel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need to know whether he is causing this or if he's infected himself. Either way, he may kill more people. I'm sure Dr. Lyle will agree.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right, we just got our order. We're going to continue on.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Says who?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Says the boss.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Agent Doggett. This agent you work with deals with weird stuff, right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She works on something called the X-Files-- FBI cases dealing with unexplained phenomena.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: You know her at all?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I know her. We've worked together for a short time.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: I wonder why she sent you down here instead of coming herself.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's the right call. You got a problem, Lieutenant?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Yeah. A problem when somebody I don't know keeps me down herein the dark looking for jack squat when we've already found our man.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's a question of contagion.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: It's a question of who's in charge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You all right down there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Fine. What do you got for us?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're about 50 yards from the spot where the train stopped.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What am I looking for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. Anything.

speaker: MELNICK
line: Get it off me. Get it off me!

speaker: LYLE
line: What is it?

speaker: MELNICK
line: I don't know, but it burns!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Just hold still. Let us see it.

speaker: MELNICK
line: It burns!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it? What's happening? Agent Doggett?!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't tell what it is.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, talk to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, um, get some fresh water on it!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Give me water here!

speaker: LYLE
line: What the hell was that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know, and I don't like it that you don't know!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, talk to me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what to say... I, mean, i-it's something attacking the dermis.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Attacking? It ate his arm off!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I hate to say this, Agent Doggett but it looks like it could be some kind of biochemical weapon.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Great.

speaker: LYLE
line: What?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: What did she say?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She said a lot of people might be taking cabs home tonight.

speaker: MELNICK
line: What the hell is this thing?!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It might be a terrorist using some kind of biochemical agent.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Might? What, is she guessing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, I pulled up a map of the subway grid where you are now. I want you to listen to me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully's telling me the tunnel we're in connects to another tunnel 100 yards up. It's the only place for another mile that this guy could be hiding.

speaker: LYLE
line: Well, this man ain't going nowhere.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Then you take care of him. I'll have a hazmat team come down here and prep you for quarantine. Lieutenant, let's go.

speaker: LYLE
line: All right, buddy. I'm gonna get you out of here. Come on. Come on. I got you, buddy. Hang in there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Lyle... Dr. Lyle, how are you feeling?

speaker: LYLE
line: Me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: LYLE
line: Well, I seem to be okay, but Melnick... Melnick is getting worse.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we got vehicles on the way. The CDC doctors have been informed of your conditions.

speaker: LYLE
line: So, what are they going to be treating us for? How are they going to treat Melnick?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm working on that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey! What are you doing?! Hey, where are you taking them? Those bodies go to the CDC... Look, as a federal agent I order you to stop and explain yourself.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: Agent Scully, we are on a deadline here, which is fast approaching.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These bodies need immediate examination and diagnosis.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: And that is being arranged.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By whom? I already arranged it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You knew those bodies were down there, didn't you?

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: I'd watch yourself, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at the way they're wrapped. Somebody sealed them in plastic, hoping they wouldn't be found. Look, if I find out you sent my partner and those others down there knowing about this...

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: You are way out of line here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want to see inspection reports. I want to know who was down there in that tunnel and what they saw.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: I'll get you anything you want.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good. Now, let's get these bodies to the CDC where they're supposed to go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's this here, Lieutenant?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Abandoned station-- old stop.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully... Agent Scully...

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Here we are, we're pissing away our time and she's asleep at the wheel.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Come on, Agent Doggett. Make a decision. Let's get out of here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We got to find whoever it is that's still down here, Lieutenant.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: And what if we don't find him? Maybe it'll be us they find lying facedown on the floor, dead.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully knows what she's doing. This is about saving people's lives.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Well, it looks like it's about saving her life. If she knows what she's doing why hasn't she figured it out yet?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Lieutenant... Walk towards me.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: What? What, damn it?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: The stuff's on me. You see that it's spreading. I told you, Agent Doggett-- we should've gotten out.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's exactly why we got to stay.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: You saw! You saw what it does.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I saw what it did. But I don't see it having any other effect on you, so just calm down.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: I'm getting out of here. I'm leaving.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: You'd do it, wouldn't you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not because I want to. But you're pushing pretty hard. So put your weapon down, Lieutenant, right now.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Now, we're going to get out of here but we're going to wait for the okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett? Agent Doggett, can you... Agent Doggett? Come in, Agent Doggett. Agent Doggett! Come in, damn it!

speaker: [CARRIK
line: She is obviously worried about Doggett, but if this were Mulder down in that tunnel, baby or no baby, 400 rabid, acid-blooded, black oil infected aliens would not be able to keep her from running down into that tunnel to save him. No scene could make the point more clear that she considers herself Doggett's co-worker. She already has a partner and will not replace him.)

speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
line: Is this a bad time?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me?

speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
line: I don't know, I'm looking for an FBI Agent Dana Scully. Do you know where I can find him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No... Yes... I mean, I'm-I'm she. Can I help you?

speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
line: Yes. I'm Dr. Kai Bowe. I was sent a scribbled note and a saltwater sample for analysis. I'm a marine biologist from BU.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry. Yes, Dr. Bowe, please. Um... Did you get an analysis?

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: Well, yes, I have something to show you, that's for sure. I'm going to assume you're in a hurry.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: This is an image taken from a stereo microscope of what's called a medusa. Your saltwater sample was rather deceiving. Its components are exactly as you'd expect except for higher levels of calcium. This creature is primarily that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Calcium?

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: Yes, it's what powers its movement and gives it bioluminescence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're saying that this is a sea creature? Which is why the CDC missed it.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: Well, it's hard to find. I daresay I'm not even sure if it's of the sea but... wherever it's from, it... it's quite incredible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's killing people.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. There is seawater in that subway tunnel and it's eating people's flesh off. It's producing some kind of a â€¦ a reaction that looks almost electrical.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: On contact?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Something triggers it.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: Have you been in the tunnel?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I have not. But my partner is down there, and I fear the worst.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Hey, hey... Anybody out there?

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Somebody! Anybody hear me?! Anybody?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett? Agent Doggett, can you hear me? Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. I'm here. I hear you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, you had me. I, uh... I started fearing the worst.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, I... I got blindsided by... I don't see Lieutenant Bianco. He's infected with something. I saw it glowing on his skin.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what's your condition, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm going to assume it's not good.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to send a quarantine unit down to get you, Agent Doggett, okay? I want you to stay right where you are.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I appreciate it, Agent Scully, but I can't do that. If we're going to stop the spread of this thing I got to stop Lieutenant Bianco.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Bowe, I need you to get on the phone with the CDC. Tell them everything we know. We have to learn as quickly as possible what sets this thing off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look... I need you to blockade any and every exit from the system. You've got a possible outbreak situation here.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: No, no. That's not going to happen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you listen to me. Your lieutenant is infected and at large in the system and he is looking for a way out.

speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF KARRAS
line: I hear you. It's just that there are already passengers waiting on the platform.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett... We've got a new wrinkle.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Don't tell me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're running out of time. It's 20 to 4:00.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm moving as fast as I can.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, you shouldn't be moving at all.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: In 20 minutes I'll be taking a long bath at the hotel. Right now, I got to find this guy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This organism that's on your skin-- something triggers it, and I don't know what. It could be body temperature. It could be heart rate.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It could be from standing still, too, right? Maybe the only thing keeping me from sparking up right now is that I'm moving.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I guess you're right.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm getting out of this thing, Agent Scully. Just make sure Karras holds those trains till I find Bianco.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's got passengers waiting at the next station.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You tell that son of a bitch he's got to clear the system. He's...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Wait. I see something.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Lieutenant... He's hurt.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You see this, Dr. Bowe?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You see this, Mr. Karras?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're on with the CDC?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need anything they can give me about what sets this organism off-- an idea, a notion, a wild guess.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, what do you want me to do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get out of there, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What about this man?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to send a hazmat team down for him but from what I've seen the reaction's progressive.

speaker: LT. BIANCO
line: Please, Agent Doggett, don't leave me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I hope you're enjoying the ride.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You see this, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: Who else is down there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We don't know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You, there! Stop! Federal Agent! I'm armed!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, believe this?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who are you? What's your name? What are you doing down here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's he pointing at?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: Is he infected?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, turn the light away.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Nothing. He's unaffected.

speaker: DR. BOWE
line: How's that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I just figured it out. I might know what triggers this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sweat. Perspiration is a conductor for calcium ions promoting a chemical-electrical reaction.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Electricity?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's right. And since the boy's sweat glands aren't fully developed then he wouldn't be as conductive.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Just my luck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, where's he going?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know, but he wants me to follow him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, I don't know if you can see this. I think I found the source of the contagion. It looks like a big leak in the ceiling is crumbling the walls flooding into the system. It must have seeped in from the bay. Hey, where you going?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You see this? The kid's walking right through this stuff.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I'm... I'm checking my graphic here. It... It looks like he's trying to lead you through to a tunnel on the main system. And, if what I'm looking at is accurate, it would put you about 400 yards from an access point. I mean, if I could put a hazmat team together we might be able to have you out in about 15 minutes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Come on, Lieutenant.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We're in through to the main system, Agent Scully and we got big, big problems here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, we do.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You see this flooding?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. It's worse than that. I think this moron Karras has started the trains rolling.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett what are you doing? Agent Doggett... Get off the tracks, Agent Doggett. Get out of there!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We got people on the train. They could get infected.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get out of there, Agent Doggett!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Give it to me! Give it to me!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I got an idea, Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett? Talk to me, Agent Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, are you there? Can you hear me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah. Yeah, I'm here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank god. Uh... I lost you on the visual.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay... Okay, I've got you. You're back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you okay?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can only hope, Agent Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Nurse! Nurse!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where do you think you're going?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Find the nurse. She said she was going to talk to the doctor about me going home. I could be dying in here for all she knows.

speaker: [CARRIK
line: Oh, so male. Manly Man Meter just went up again.]

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you're not... Agent Doggett. Your skin and body have been rid of the organism. Simple alcohol bath cleaned you right up. I was just down talking to the nurse and I told her I'd come and give you the news.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, can I get out of here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What about the others?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the kid is with Social Services and plastic surgeons are working on Melnick and Bianco and Dr. Lyle has been discharged.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, I'd like to think that this was over but there's going to be hell to pay for these guys.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. It's over, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Excuse me? This guy Karras put a train back on the tracks. He recklessly endangered people's lives.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But there is no proof of that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you mean, there's no proof?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What I'm saying is that the organism is no longer extant. It's destroyed.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: By what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm guessing by the electrical charge that you set off.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We have victims. Dead bodies.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Infected by a pathogen of unknown aetiology.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, Agent Doggett, not a criminal charge is going to stick. These guys were just doing their job-- keeping the trains running.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But they've got you to thank. And not just for saving their butts.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. You figured it out. I was just your eyes and ears.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's go home.
